docs.snippet: The current study by banking authorities to improve methods of processing checks was started none too soon, it appears, for the flood of checks handled in this area continues unabated and is even rising. According to figures compiled by the Federal...
docs.lead_paragraph: The current study by banking authorities to improve methods of processing checks was started none too soon, it appears, for the flood of checks handled in this area continues unabated and is even rising. According to figures compiled by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, during the last Columbus Day week, the bank handled 8,079,000 checks in the four-day period.

docs.snippet: Strong opposition to fees or quotas on imported wools was expressed by two leading wool textile manufacturers in letters to President Truman, it was made known yesterday. Francis W. White, president of American Woolen Company, urged Mr. Truman to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Strong opposition to fees or quotas on imported wools was expressed by two leading wool textile manufacturers in letters to President Truman, it was made known yesterday. Francis W. White, president of American Woolen Company, urged Mr. Truman to refuse to impose fees if the Tariff Commission should recommend such action, and to direct countervailing duties on South American wool tops.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27 -- Five member states, led by France, demanded today that the United Nations revive a controversial news pact, approved in 1949, and ask Governments to adhere to one section under which they would be requested to...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27 -- Five member states, led by France, demanded today that the United Nations revive a controversial news pact, approved in 1949, and ask Governments to adhere to one section under which they would be requested to circulate "corrections" to false or distorted news dispatches.

docs.snippet: Mounting opposition to higher duty payments on raw wool -- technically in the form of a fee on top of existing rates -- was cited by foreign trade sources yesterday as likely to bring modification of pending proposals for increased import levies on...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mounting opposition to higher duty payments on raw wool -- technically in the form of a fee on top of existing rates -- was cited by foreign trade sources yesterday as likely to bring modification of pending proposals for increased import levies on the commodity.
